Description:
Active Movement offers a unique approach to tackling childhood obesity
and provides a different approach to traditional weight management 
programmes; encouraging behaviour change and implementing whole 
school engagement through education. The non-stigmatising universal 
programme aims to reduce sedentary behaviour by building physical 
activity into day-to-day life. Further campaigns can be added to the 
programme such as Oral Health and Active Travel component.

Title: Investment in Supported Internships Programme
Description:
Supported Internships (SIs) are a work-based study programme for 16-24 year olds with SEND who have an Education Health and Care plan, who want to move into employment and who need extra support to do so. SIs are designed to equip young people with the skills they need to secure and sustain employment through learning in the workplace.

The DfE wants to build the capacity of the SI programme and are aiming to double the number of SIs from c.2,250 internship enrolments per annum to c.4,500 per annum by 2025.

Following an open procurement process in compliance with the Public Contract Regulations (2015) (as amended). Contracts have been awarded to deliver services to meet these aims:

Lot 1 'Strengthening the Supported Internships Programme' worth up to a maximum total value of £4,537,165.04 (exc VAT)

Lot 2 'Delivery of Job Coach training' worth up to a maximum total value of 1,219,651.50 (exc VAT)

Both contracts will run until 31st March 2024, at which point, a further 12 month extension may be exercised at the discretion of the Contracting Authority.

On 09/11/2023 a variation was completed on the Lot 1 contract 'Strengthening the Supported Internships Programme' to administer and monitor additional grants to local authorities to test the supported internships model for those with Learning Disabilities and Difficulties but without Education, Health and Care plans (EHCPs). 

The additional cost of this variation is £197,285.92 (exc. VAT) bringing the Lot 1 contract value total to £4,734,450.96 (exc. VAT). The total value of both contracts is now £5,954,102.46 (exc. VAT).
Attachments: Redacted Contract - Lot 1.pdf Redacted Contract Lot 2.pdf REDACTED - Lot 1 Strengthening the Supported Internships Programme - con_15248 - Variation 001.pdf

Title: CPCA - Adult Education Budget (AEB)
Description:
The Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Combined Authority (the CPCA) covers the Local Authority areas of Cambridgeshire County Council, Cambridge City Council, Peterborough City Council, Fenland District Council, Huntingdonshire District Council, East Cambridgeshire District Council and South Cambridgeshire District Council.\r
\r
The CPCA intends to procure high quality adult education and training. CPCA are seeking to build effective contractual relationships and continue to implement local flexibilities through our devolution agreement. Successful training providers will deliver contracts for services that meet our quality standards and delivery expectations aligned to the skills needs of the CPCA region. Through the tendering process successful providers will demonstrate an understanding of our local authority areas, the needs of resident learners and employers, and how they would work alongside our FE Colleges and Local Authority grant funded organisations to add value to the local curriculum offer for CPCA residents.\r
\r
From the 2019/20 academic year, the CPCA has held responsibility for the regions share of devolved Adult Education Budget (AEB) and how it is delivered. The AEB aims to engage adults and provide them with the skills and learning needed for work or further learning. In addition, it will improve employability skills including communication, self-confidence and attitude to work and enable people to contribute to the social wellbeing of their community.\r
\r
In addition to the AEB, further government funding from the National Skills Fund: Level 3 adult Offer has been delegated to the CPCA for Level 3 Courses for the 2022/23 academic year.\r
\r
The CPCAs vision is to increase skills and career progression through a network of providers operating as a 'skills escalator', in enabling adults to increase their skills levels, their productivity, and quality of life, by progressing from lower to higher levels of learning and earnings.\r
\r
A headline focus of this Commissioning round is to:\r
â€¢ Increase the proportion of Peterborough and Fenland residents with a Level 3 qualification\r
â€¢ Reduce the number of Peterborough and Fenland residents with no formal qualifications\r
â€¢ Target residents living in the relatively most deprived postcodes in the sub-regions, including wider Cambridgeshire and parts of Cambridge City\r
\r
CPCAs overall commissioning approach will involve a combination of plan-led commissioning with grant providers and procured provision delivered through Contract for Services. This opportunity is concerned solely with procured activity.\r
\r
We expect that funding for the new Multiply program will be allocated to the CPCA for a three-year period from 2022/23 - 2024-25 academic year. Please be aware that at the time of publication, funding for Multiply has not been confirmed however is being included in this procurement to enable us to efficiently plan for and procure providers ready for launch in Autumn 2022.

Title: QU802 - 175-year Director of Public Health in Birmingham Report  - AWARD
Description:
The Director of Public Health (DPH) role is marking 175 years in Birmingham. Initially known as Medical Officer of Health until 1974, the DsPH have worked to protect and preserve Birmingham Health and improve Wellbeing for 175 years. It is important that the journey is captured, documented and mapped so, as a city and Council, along with its partners, we can reflect on the achievement of introducing this role. It is also important to reflect on any developmental area that will help and ensure that the citizens' Health and Wellbeing are at the heart of the Council's priorities. 
      
      The Council will provide appropriate and proportionate expert public health advice, support and signpost to appropriate information. The Council will work with the provider to enable the contract delivery as much as possible. Example of support are as below. This list is not exhaustive
      
      o Guidance throughout to ensure the report maps the service specification
      o Support with incorporating the two pieces of work, as set out in Service specification (i.b) to ensure smooth, appropriate and adequate incorporation and synthesis.
      o Information on key languages for translations
      o Reference to key books, articles and legislations. The list is not exhaustive. 
      
      The draft report should be ready in by 31st October 2022 to factor in feedback and design/formatting and translations.
      
      The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity, please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register. You will then be sent details on how to log on which will enable you to download all relevant quotation documentation.
      If you are unable to register with In-tend or have any questions or problems on how to use this web site please either email us at: cps@birmingham.gov.uk 
      
      Your completed tender submission should be returned by 5pm on 8th August 2022  via the 'in-tend' system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc

Title: Kirklees Adult Learning 2022
Description:
The Council of the Borough of Kirklees (the "Council") is conducting this procurement exercise, in accordance with the Light Touch Regime of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (SI 2015/102), and intends to establish an Electronic Market Place ("EMP") with Delivery Partners with relevant experience and ability to provide Adult Education, Training, Employment & Lifelong Learning on a non-exclusive basis  Further details regarding the Services required are set out in the General Specification (Schedule 2) and in the Conditions of Contract (Schedule 4 Appendix 2). This EMP is anticipated to commence on 1st June 2022 for a period of five (5) years subject to continued availability of eligible Contractors continuing to meet the requirements and demands of the Service.    The estimated cumulative annual value for the Contracts potentially called off under this EMP is Seven Hundred and Fifty Thousand Pounds Sterling (£750,000) per annum. 

The initial Submission Deadline for the receipt of Requests to Participate is 16th May 2022 at 13:00hrs and will be quarterly thereafter.

Further Competitions will commence from 1st June 2022 until 31st May 2027

Title: CCS006 Provision of Strategic Partner  for Schools and Learning
Description:
Derbyshire has circa 420 schools and the Council funds early years education for around 18,000 children and supports approximately 20,000 children and young people with special educational needs or disabilities to access education. Education outcomes are generally strong, with the principal issue being around consistency across the county.

Despite the positive trends it is recognised that the Council needs to change to ensure it is well positioned to meet the challenges which the county's education community faces.

We are therefore seeking a Strategic Partner for Schools and Learning who will over the 18 months it is envisaged this transformation will last, as we learn more detail from the government, assist the Council to meet its key strategic transformation themes.

Title: Applying a published approach for deriving resistance selection concentrations for antibiotics to antifungals
Description: The project involves the application of a method proposed by Bengtsson-Palme and Larsson (2016) to a range of clinical and agricultural fungicides of interest.  It requires the collation of the relevant data for use in the method initially and then the application of the method to the data located to derive MSC and PNEC values for resistance for the substances of interest.

Title: North Northamptonshire Council - Residential and Nursing Care Homes
Description:
North Northamptonshire Council wishes to invite tenders for the provision of residential and/or nursing care for people aged predominantly 65 years and over. Individuals placed by the Council will be ordinarily resident within the North Northamptonshire and meet the admission criteria for people requiring residential, nursing or respite care.

The Service will be required to provide regulated accommodation, care, support and meaningful activity to those people for whom it is not appropriate, either in the short or longer term, to live in their own homes.

The Service will be delivered in a way that ensure Individuals are at the heart of service delivery by maximising their ability and opportunity to live as independently as possible through the provision of good quality care and compliance with regulatory care standards.

For Providers who are currently in a contract or out of contract with NNC and agree to be appointed to the DPS, NNC will review and uplift their weekly care package cost in line with the new contracted expected to pay rate set out in the DPS. On appointment to the DPS, any existing agreements or arrangements covering the same scope as the DPS, will be extinguished and superseded by the DPS.

The Council proposes to enter into one (1) Contract for an initial period of 48 months with the preferred Potential Supplier, with an option to extend for 12 months, making 60  months in total.

The light touch regime (LTR) applies to the Services under this DPS, as per Public Contracts Regulations 2015.
Additional Text: Please visit the North Northamptonshire Council e-Procurement Portal (https://in-tendhost.co.uk/nnc/aspx/Home) to express an interest in this opportunity and to access the documentation.

Title: Prescribing Decision Support Tool Provision for NHS Mid and South Essex Integrated Care Board
Description:
The Prescribing Decision Support Tool enables prescribers (GPs, nurses and pharmacists) to understand the recommended local choices for prescribing. The implementation of this system creates significant savings through prescribers accepting the recommended switches and also educates prescribers to select those first choice products the next time these are prescribed. The tool also provides safety messages at the point of prescribing.

A contract to deliver the Prescribing Decision Support Tool across the Mid and South Essex Integrated Care Board (MSE ICB) area has been awarded to Optum. This contract has been awarded via the SBS Framework for Medicines Management Prescribing Decision Support Systems 2 (Reference SBS/19/AB/WAS/9389) following a review of all available tools within the Framework to fully explore the service offering to enable an informed decision to be made on which tool best meets the needs of the Contracting Authority and provides the best value for money solution, in line with the requirements of the Framework Agreement.

This contract commences 1st September 2022 for a period of 24 months until the 31st August 2024, with the option to extend the contract for a further 12 months. The total aggregate contract value is £1,008,450.00 (excluding VAT). The total aggregate contract value is £1,210,140.00 (inclusive of VAT) and this figure has been reflected in the award notice published by the Authority in line with Contracts Finder publishing guidance.
Contact Address 1: Unit 10 Phoenix Court, Christopher Martin Road
Additional Text: NHS Mid and South Essex Integrated Care Board have undertaken a compliant procurement process as a call-off from the SBS Framework to identify, and appoint, the most appropriate supplier to deliver the services in line with the commissioners requirements.

Title: All-Age Advocacy Hub and Right to Representation for Children Service
Description:
Medway Council invites tenders for an All-Age Advocacy Hub and Right to Representation for Children Service. The requirements are divided into 2 lots:

Lot 1 - All-Age Advocacy Hub
The service will deliver several functions including:
A. Statutory Independent Mental Capacity Advocacy (IMCA)
B. Statutory Independent Mental Health Advocacy (IMHA)
C. Statutory Independent Advocacy under the Care Act (CA)
D. Statutory Deprivation of Liberty Standards (DoLS) conducted by Relevant Person's Representative (RPR)
E. Independent NHS Complaints Advocacy.
F. Developing community advocacy and self-advocacy /peer advocacy
G. Coordinating the provision of advocacy service for people placed outside of Medway where Medway retains statutory responsibility for their provision.

Lot 2 - Right to Representation for Children
The service requirements for Lot 2 combine several elements listed below. The specification for each service includes the legal context, the aims and objectives, national standards, eligibility criteria, access referral process and expected outcomes:
• Children's advocacy
• Independent Visitors
• Appropriate Adults
• Children in Care Council

Title: Provision of Gas Tight Suits for Staffordshire Fire and Rescue Service
Description:
Exemption signed off for the supply of Gas Tight Suits with Respirex. 

Respirex were the only supplier who could supply a suit that met the current specification that was in use at SFRS. It was confirmed that changing the specification of suit could have a lot of implications in terms of fire fighter protection and changes to training requirements. I researched potential frameworks for gas tight suits and currently none exist. It also looks as though other FRS across the country use the same supplier. 

There is no Contract in place with the supplier and individual orders will be place with the supplier. The Contract end date is the date that the exemption covers.

The value is an estimate. I put £50K for the value as its estimated to be between £45 -£52K.

Title: Chemical Engineering and Process Safety Training Course
Description:
There is and will continue to be significant demand for development of chemical engineering and process safety competence within COMAH and EPR Installations regulation and the supporting functions due to a significant reduction in availability due to retirement, recruitment and internal transfer of staff without a chemical engineering, chemistry and /or process safety background. EPR Installations regulation and COMAH regulation require chemical engineering competence to be able to read, discuss, review, interpret and utilise process and chemistry related information and basic process safety competence to appreciate process hazards and how they could impact the environment. 
COMAH regulation requires process safety competence to be able to read, discuss, review, interpret and utilise process hazard and risk related information with HSE (the EA's COMAH Competent Authority partner) and with Operators.

Title: ExCALIBUR Fusion Modelling System FM-WP2 Plasma multiphysics model: Advanced Referent Model Procurement
Description: Radical changes to supercomputer architectures are on the horizon. The current simulation codes, that much of UK science relies upon, are designed for current supercomputer architectures. These codes will, at best, not be able to fully exploit the power that the supercomputers of the mid-2020s will deliver; at worst, they will run slower on those machines than they do now. Future computers will be more energy efficient and so the longer we rely upon the current approach, the more expensive the solution will be. Therefore, it is essential that we invest now in redesigning those simulation codes so that they perform well on the future generations of supercomputers.

Title: FEW1032 - Walk to School
Description:
Living Streets currently provides a service called Walk to School whereby schools sign up to participate in assemblies and events They are provided with information and incentives to encourage more children and their carers to leave the car at home and walk to school.  For those who need to travel by car because they live too far away they are encouraged to Park and Stride for at least 10 mins on their journey to school.  The methods by which the children have travelled to school are recorded on a digital travel tracker each day.  This monitoring information is recorded and can be accessed by LCC to help with planning.  Living Streets has also worked with Secondary Schools, Further Education Colleges and the Universities to encourage students to walk more. \r
\r
Central Government gave very short notice for ending their direct contract with Living Streets to deliver this service in Leicester and various local authority areas around the country.  LCC has benefitted from this work since 2012 and would like to continue to work with Living Streets to provide this service in our schools.  Living Streets are the only supplier who could start this contract at 1st April 2021 and continue the work they have been doing.  Their staff have built up good relationships with schools in Leicester and most schools are happy to use the resources and monitoring tools that they supply.  The unique travel tracker monitoring results are used by the City Council for evidence about travel in an area and when we seek funding for other projects.\r
\r
Living Streets were previously contracted to supply this service in Leicester by the Department for Transport (DfT). The DfT have ended their direct contract with Living Streets but have provided the funding for the work directly to LCC and other authorities as part of the Capability Fund so that LCC can continue to fund this service provision.\r
LA's who receive this funding are encouraged to work with Living Streets to deliver the service.

Title: ICT Enterprise Systems Services
Description:
Enterprise Systems Services are the services and activities required to provide and support NWP's on premise data centre environment (300 virtual servers and approximately 60 physical servers ) and its components such as compute, storage, databases, middleware and backup environments as applicable for NWP hybrid cloud environment (on-premises, public cloud and managed/virtual managed cloud environment). Outcomes required: NWP are developing a cloud migration approach including a cloud readiness assessment. NWP will require the successful bidder to support the reduction of the on-premise estate and the growth of the cloud footprint, likely utilising Azure in harmony with the National Enablement Programme.

Title: The Supply, Delivery, Erection, Maintenance and Repair of Fencing and Gating
Description:
The London Borough of Hillingdon owns a housing stock of approximately 10,000 properties located on a number of estates within the geographical area of the Borough. The Council also provides services to residents from a number of corporate buildings, libraries, theatres, day centres and children's homes and manages parks and golf courses. Fencing and gating of various types and constructions are installed at many of these properties.  
Some fencing and gating requirements are planned whilst others are reactive and involve the repair or replacement of damaged panels, posts and gates often at very short notice to ensure the safety and security of residents, employees and the general public. The types of fencing and gating installed and the extent of the works required vary in each case and depend upon the location and the particular requirement. The Council is also responsible for installing and maintaining the condition of boundary fences and gates on its corporate properties and open spaces.
The proposed contract is for the supply and installation of new fencing and gating or the repair / replacement of existing where the maximum value will not exceed £5,000 (excluding VAT) for each job. All other fencing and gating requirements with an anticipated value in excess of this sum will be subject to further competition.  
Contract Period
The Contract will be for a period of three (3) years with options to extend for a further two (2) years subject to the requirements of the service and the performance of the contractor.
Contact Address 1: London Borough of Hillingdon, Civic Centre,
Additional Text: The London Borough of Hillingdon is NOT inviting all interested organisations to tender as this is an Award Notice.

The scope of the proposed works comprises the safe removal and disposal of existing combustible Trespa Meteon high pressure laminate cladding panels, including KT15 Kingspan insulation with timber studs, fitted to 6No Residential Blocks of Flats up to a height of 25m. The design, supply and installation of an external RockPanel Cladding System in lieu of the existing combustible Trespa cladding and insulation materials, to satisfy the Building Regulations. In addition, the works also include installing new associated cavity fire barriers and fire stopping around windows and doors.

Title: (NU/1798) Supply of an Ion Chromatography coupled Mass Spectrometer System
Description:
Research groups across the faculty of Science, Agriculture and Engineering and Faculty of Medical Sciences at Newcastle University have secured funding from the BBSRC 21ALERT for an Ion Chromatography coupled Mass Spectrometer for Carbohydrate analysis. The system will enable separation, quantification, and structural analysis of complex carbohydrates critically including those without known standards.

The scope of this contract is for the supply, delivery and installation of the equipment, as detailed in the Invitation to Tender documentation to the University, with after-sales support and 36 months warranty and maintenance.

This opportunity is only being made available to those Sellers appointed to Lot 6 (Forthcoming Systems and Modular/Combined Systems) of the APUC Framework Agreement for Supply of Mass Spectrometry and Chromatography Equipment (Ref: LAB1016AP).

To initiate a consortium of commercial, academic, government and public entities with interest in the post-use recovery, re-use and recycling of REE PM from EV1 and wind energy application.

Title: 704694450 - CCCT/754 Provision of Simplified Technical English Training
Description:
Having conducted a survey across the Air Domain, 25 people have been identified as requiring training in Simplified Technical English (STE). Course attendees will need to learn the theory and reasons as to why STE is important, with examples providing insights into best and worse practices. They are also required to have hands-on practice, applying STE writing rules and making use of the dictionary that follows the ASD-STE100 Specification.
The successful supplier is asked to deliver training only for DE&S staff, rather than offer places on a public course.
The trainer or the training organisation must be a member of the Simplified Technical English Maintenance Group (STEMG) and must be experienced in the use of STE either in the Aviation or Defence Industry.

Title: IA12 Sub Systems: Port plug, DSM an DFW
Description:
UK Atomic Energy Authority (UKAEA), based at the Culham Science Centre in Oxfordshire, hereafter referred to as the Purchaser, carries out research into the use of controlled fusion for the generation of power.

In support of the international ITER fusion experiment, under the ITER Robotic Test Facility (IRTF) scope of work, the Purchaser aims to demonstrate the feasibility of remote maintenance operations, that will be carried out within the ITER Hot Cell Complex (HCC). This is being demonstrated through full-scale physical mock-up trials, at the premises of the Purchaser. The results of these trials will inform the final design of the relevant components and systems.

As part of this work, the manufacture and assembly of a mock-up Port Plug, Diagnostic Shield Module (DSM) and Diagnostic First Wall (DFW) and all associated fixings is required.

It should be noted that although it will be necessary to manufacture the components to the exacting standards required for the Purchaser site, they will not be operating in a radiation environment.

Organisation Name: NHS Arden and Greater East Midlands Commissioning Support Unit
Title: Cystinosis Diagnosis and Management Advice Service
Description:
NHS England is seeking to commission a service to deliver cystinosis diagnosis and management advice through the publication of this provider selection process.
Services will be provided from 3 adult and paediatric hubs, either as a joint bid between two organisations (one covering adult services and one covering paediatric services) or as a single integrated service bid from the same organisation, covering both adult and paediatric services. Services will be selected to offer geographically equitable access to minimise patient travel times whilst also offering access to multidisciplinary resources. Services will support national networking of the highly specialised centres with the adult and paediatric centres working closely together to offer an integrated service and excellent transition of patients. The hubs will be required to work in a national network to support the development of national policies and protocols and to facilitate research.
The hub allocation model will be based on a regional lot breakdown as follows:
• Lot 1 - one hub for adult and paediatric cystinosis services to cover the NHS England population in the North of England
• Lot 2 - one hub for adult and paediatric cystinosis services to cover the NHS England population in the Midlands and northern areas of East of England
• Lot 3 - one hub for adult and paediatric cystinosis services to cover the NHS England population in the South of England and southern areas of East of England
Providers wishing to be considered for the delivery of these services will need to respond to the provider selection documentation and submit responses prior to the deadline stated in this notice.

Organisation Name: Edmonton Academy Trust C/o School Smart Consultants Limited
Title: SSC EDAT Catering Service Contract 01_09
Description: Edmonton Academy Trust are seeking a suitably qualified and experienced Contractor to supply catering services to Edmonton County Primary, Secondary and Sixth Form Schools and new Salmon's Brook School located in North London, United Kingdom.The Trust will sign a contract with the successful Contractor for a period of 36 months with the option to extend for up to a further 24 months. It is expected that the contract will commence 1st September 2022.Tenders must be submitted in accordance with the Invitation to Tender instructions.It is the intent of the Trust to offer a good value meal service to pupils and staff. Within the constraints of the meal price the Tenderer shall be required to provide a good quality, nutritionally balanced meal for the children, through an efficient service with a good standard of presentation and a menu that meets the varying dietary needs of the nationalities of the children. Service should be personal and responsive at a Silver Food for Life standard.The Trust is keen to open a separate provision for the 6th form. Offering an all-day service, providing a range of suitable snacks and beverages that are appealing and priced to retain patronage throughout the day. A coffee offer is central to the provision of these offers.The Secondary campuses have the benefit of two external service pods (one at each site). Currently these pods are not being used. The Trust would like Tenderers to consider the incorporation of these pods and the possibility of other areas that could be utilised across the sites.In addition, there is a potential to offer a service for lettings. Tenderers proposals and ideas will be welcomed and considered.The Trust is keen to appoint a catering contractor who can drive the services forward in an innovative and exciting manor.

This Call-Off Contract i.e. the direct award within the G-Cloud 12 framework is for the provision of Services under Lot 2: Cloud software. Access to a secure cloud-based platform enabling the collection of attendance and attainment data for vulnerable cohorts of children including reporting and analytics.

The aim of the service is to collect the daily school attendance marks of children in the care of Hampshire County Council (HCC) where it is not possible for the Data and Information Team (DaIT) to do this.  

The HCC require the services of a provider to contact schools on a daily basis (by phone) to collect school attendance marks on our behalf (in the specific circumstances detailed) and send them securely and electronically to the HCC Data and Information Team. Description:
This contract relates to an operational technology reporting service for National Highways CCTV, MIDAS and SVD assets.

This service will improve the availability of National Highways CCTV, MIDAS and SVD assets and reduce the time taken to restore device services following identification of faults. In order to achieve this objective, this reporting service will interface with the outputs from various fault monitoring sources and generate information rich service tickets for National Highways operators.

Title: INVITATION TO TENDER FOR THE DEMOLITION AND CONSTRUCTION OF NEW ENTRANCE, REPLACEMENT ROOF COVERINGS AND ASSOCIATED REMEDIAL WORKS.
Description:
Opened in 1994 the current Tadley and District Community Centre replaced the original community building that was a former US Air Force gymnasium.  The Community Centre comprises two main halls with various meeting rooms, kitchen and café area. The Centre is typically open from 8am - 8pm and is used by a variety of people and groups. 

Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council ('the Council') is seeking to appoint a suitable contractor to undertake the demolition of the existing and construction of a new lobby and foyer together with the replacement of the roof covering to the two main halls and flat roof to the valley gutter along with all remedial and associated works.
Additional Text:
Introduction

 Opened in 1994 the current Tadley and District Community Centre replaced the original community building that was a former US Air Force gymnasium.  The Community Centre comprises two main halls with various meeting rooms, kitchen and café area. The Centre is typically open from 8am - 8pm and is used by a variety of people and groups. 
Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council ('the Council') is seeking to appoint a suitable contractor to undertake the demolition of the existing and construction of a new lobby and foyer together with the replacement of the roof covering to the two main halls and flat roof to the valley gutter along with all remedial and associated works.  

Property Address -   Tadley Community Centre, Newchurch Road, Tadley, RG26 4HN, Hampshire.

Works are to be carried out as per the specification included in the tender documents. 

Dispatch of ITT:    Thursday 7th July 2022
Questions & Answers:   Thurs 7th July 2022  -  Thurs 4th August 2022
Return of Tender:     12.00.00 Wednesday 10th August 2022
Evaluation of Tender:  Wednesday 24th August 2022   
Notification of Contract Award to Tenderers:   Tuesday 30th August 2022
Contract commencement meeting:   TBA 

The Council reserves the right to change the above timetable and Tenderers will be notified accordingly where there is a change in the timetable.
The Council is utilising an electronic tendering tool to manage this procurement and communicate with Tenderers.  Accordingly, there will be no hard copy documents issued to Tenderers and all communications with the Council, including the submission of Tenderers' Responses, will be conducted via the ProContract system, which can be accessed using the following link:
http://sebp.due-north.com

If you need any further assistance or have any queries about using the ProContract system please contact the PROACTIS support team; contact details are as follows:

Email ProContractSuppliers@proactis.com OR log a support call directly using the following link: http://proactis.kayako.com/procontractv3/Core/Default/Index quoting project  DN621198
Please note expressions of interest must be registered before 11.30a.m on Wednesday 10th August 2022. Completed tenders and supporting information should be returned no later than 12:00:00 on Wednesday 10th August 2022.

Title: Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent Suicide Prevention Partnership - #TalkSuicide Champion Communities
Description:
The service will develop, support and facilitate the #TalkSuicide Champion Community Programme on behalf of the Suicide Prevention Partnership.

The #TalkSuicide Champion Communities are a network of groups based in Staffordshire and Stoke on Trent. The groups comprise of volunteers who are advocates for suicide awareness and prevention in their local area.

This advocacy involves:

Increasing awareness of suicide in their local area, and in areas and target groups identified as high priority by the Suicide Prevention Partnership, to encourage help- seeking within the community.
Increasing community capacity to identify suicidality, provide initial support and signposting.
Being aware of relevant support available within the community and identifying gaps in support

Title: BFI LONDON FILM FESTIVAL LARGE FORMAT PRINT AND BRANDING  - AWARD
Description:
The BFI is tendering for a provider for a full service solution for event and venue branding print, installation and de-rig during the BFI London Film Festival.
      
      The scope of the provision includes: the branding print, installation and de-rigs of various printed branding materials including, but not limited to, free-standing boards, posters, vinyls, fixed branding boards and other elements of temporary signage in eight to fifteen venues around London, including the festival's main area in the South Bank.
      
      Included in the requirement is the swift (potentially same day) print, install and de-rig of press boards, branding boards and crash barrier branding for around twenty red-carpet premières; print, install and de-rig of step-and-repeat boards and other venue branding; and other interior and exterior branding elements.
      The project involves some installations during September and October, as well as during the BFI London Film Festival itself (5-16 October in 2022).
      
      It is intended that the contract will be let for a period of two years from 18 July 2022 with an option to extend by up to a further two periods of one year each.
      
      Full details are set out in the ITT.

Title: Psychological Support - HEE PSW - West Midlands
Description:
Health Education England West Midlands is seeking a provider, to delivery a psychology and counselling service to trainee doctors and dentists within the West Midlands, where this type of support is deemed appropriate following initial referral to the Professional Support and Wellbeing team.  The overall aim of providing such a service is to provide short-term psychological and/or counselling support to trainees to ensure that they can continue to work and train safely.  This service is not a replacement for other avenues of support available to trainees, for example their own General Practitioner and/or other healthcare specialists such as Practitioner Health and the BMA support.  Where a trainee has a long standing health issue or mental health illness, this service should act as an interim measure whilst the trainee liaises with the appropriate services through the NHS.

It is expected that this service will be supplied from an existing service to include, a qualified Clinical Psychologist with at least six years relevant post-qualification experience,
Clinical Psychologist and Counselling Psychologist who are registered by the Health Professionals Council - accredited by the British Association for Counselling and Psychotherapy (BACP).  Cognitive Behaviour Therapists accredited by British Association for Behavioural and Cognitive Psychotherapies (BABCP).  This service will also be expected to provide the administrative support to manage the referrals.

The contract period will be 12 months with the option to extend for a further 2 periods of 12 months, subject to annual review and available budget.

This Contract shall be payable based on the volume of activity to be undertaken.

As such, there shall be no Total Contract Value, but a cost per session to be charged to the Authority, this shall be an all-inclusive cost which will cover the total number of sessions delivered.

The total contract value shall not exceed the available budget of £270,000.00 over the full 3 year contract.
Attachments: Psychological Support - HEE PSW - Contract - REDACTED.pdf

Title: Inspection, Preventative and Remedial Maintenance Service for the National Police Air Service Fuel Farm Installations and Bowsers
Description:
This requirement is for both preventative and reactive maintenance of fuel tank assets. The preventative maintenance is for routine inspection and maintenance and any repairs arising from the routine visits to fuel farm installations and mobile bowsers at various NPAS bases in England and Wales.
Maintenance and inspection of all fuel installations shall be in accordance with the Civil Aviation Authority's CAP 748 (Aviation Fuels at Aerodromes) and all work undertaken will be to the prevailing addition of JIG 4 Fuel Quality Control and Operating Standards.
The core requirement is for each fuel farm or bowser to have 2 inspections per annum at 6 monthly intervals and 1 complete tank clean every 3 years unless under advisement it is not required.
At each routine inspection the following shall be undertaken:
1. Calibration of all fitted gauges to 0.05% ±
2. Hose inspection and pressure test
3. Filter inspection / change as appropriate (ensuring correct filters are used is FSII is present)
4. Visual tank inspection
5. Additive calibration where FSII is present
6. Inspection and function check on fuelling equipment
7. Inspection and report on interceptors if supplier is able to do so
8. Legally compliant collection and disposal of waste aviation fuel from time to time, if supplier is able to do so.
9. ATEX/DSEAR Electrical EICR Inspection and reporting yearly.
10. Provision of full certification for items 1-5 in triplicate and report findings as appropriate for items 6, 7 and 8.

Title: 704_22 Outsourced Catering Services
Description:
ESPO is seeking to renew its framework agreement for outsourced catering services and is looking to identify and appoint a number of service providers to provide a wide range of catering services to customers across the public sector:

Lot 1 - Education Catering
Lot 2 - Social Care Catering
Lot 3 - Public Sector Catering

The contract has the option to extend for up to a further 24 months. The total estimated value stated includes the option period.

As part of the on-going contract management process, during the period of the Framework Agreement, ESPO shall monitor the financial stability of the awarded Service Providers during the period of the Framework Agreement by reference to credit rating agency reports. ESPO shall obtain a credit score for the Service Provider on or before the Framework start date as a base score and where a significant change in the credit score is identified over the life of the Framework Agreement, ESPO reserves the right to investigate the reasons for this significant change. Depending on the severity of the changes, it will be at the sole discretion of ESPO to suspend or even permanently remove the Service Provider from the Framework Agreement.
Contact Name: Food, Communities and Technology Procurement Team
Additional Text:
As a Central Purchasing Body as defined in the Public Contracts Regulations 2015, the Framework Agreement is open for use by Public Bodies (defined at https://www.espo.org/amfile/file/download/file/9608/) that also fall into one of the following classifications of user throughout all administrative regions of the UK: Local Authorities; Educational Establishments (including Academies); Central Government Departments and Agencies; Police, Fire & Rescue and Coastguard Emergency Services; NHS and HSC Bodies, including Ambulance Services; Registered Charities; Registered Social Landlords; The Corporate Office of the House of Lords, The Corporate Officer of the House of Commons; or any public body established by or under the Scotland Act 1998 or any Act of the Scottish Parliament. Details of the classification of end user establishments and geographical areas are available at: https://www.espo.org/legal.

ESPO has established a commercial trading company, ESPO Trading Limited, whose target clients are third sector organisations such as national and local charities, public sector mutual organisations and other organisations involved in the delivery of services to or for the public sector. The successful Supplier may be asked to enter into an additional separate framework agreement (the Second Framework) with ESPO Trading Limited on materially similar terms to that found in the tender pack to be entered into by ESPO itself.

Any Second Framework agreement will be a purely commercial agreement and will, for the avoidance of doubt, not be governed by the Public Contract Regulations 2015 or other public procurement legislation. ESPO Trading Limited may enter into the second framework agreement with the successful supplier and make it available to third sector clients who themselves are not required to follow the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 or other public procurement legislation. Accordingly, this is provided for bidders information only.

An eAuction process may be used to award subsequent call off contracts following the reopening of competition among the parties to the Framework Agreement.

Title: 2022 - 0950 Groundworks and Associated Services Price Framework - AWARD
Description:
Citizen wishes to enter into a Groundworks Framework with up to 3 contractors, for the provision of Groundworks projects and associated works to include but not limited to: 
      
      Car park and pathway refurbishment and alteration / modernisation including macadam, slabbing, kerbs, drainage replacement, road marking, minor demolition e.g. shed blocks, foundation construction and garden wall construction, bollards installation.  
      
      In addition to this but to a lesser extent there will also be 
      o water main replacement and 
      o internal concrete floor renewals (NB: this will not include any kitchen replacement or carpentry work)
      o There will also be a requirement to replace lamp posts and the like - however you will be expected to obtain two prices at the time of the works
      o Provision of landscape architect services.  This will be required on larger projects and you will be expected to obtain two prices at the time of the works
      
      If you wish to express an interest in this project please ensure you are registered and logged into our Portal. The `Express Interest` button will only appear on the Tender Management page if you are logged in.
      
      Applicants are advised to ensure that they do not base their submission on discussions with any other member of Citizen Staff. If you require any clarification on matters contained within the Tender Documents, you must do so via Correspondence of the Citizen E-Procurement portal. Failure to observe this requirement may result in your bid being eliminated.
      
      Please note that in the case of tender clarifications where appropriate, answers will be circulated to all tenderers.
      
      NB: Should you require assistance or clarification on the use of In-Tend, please contact In-Tend support on 0845 557 8079 / +44 (0) 114 407 0065.
      
      You must upload your bid by using the `Attach Documents` button and your return must be submitted via 'Submit Return' on the Citizen E-Procurement portal before the deadline date provided in the project details. You will have the option to modify you bid up until the deadline.

This contract relates to the provision of a managed infrastructure hosting service for National Highways' Advanced Traffic Management System (ATMS).

The supplier will provide Tier 3 Data Centre rack space for the hosted service, along with automated monitoring, data and system backup, storage / capacity management, and firewall services.

The contract will also include extensive Service Management and Operational Change Management, in order to ensure that the services continue to meet the performance and availability standards of National Highways at all times. The supplier will also provide a Service Desk to assist with Incident and Problem Management.

Title: Equine Disease Surveillance
Description:
The Authority, as part of its scanning surveillance to detect new and re-emerging animal disease threats (NRT) that could impact on our livestock and equine sectors and public health, has a requirement for regular intelligence on diseases prevalent in the British equine population.

Government is required for trade purposes both within the European Union and with 3rd Countries to provide evidence of freedom from some specific diseases. Data collected through scanning surveillance contributes to this guarantee. In addition, it is recognised that early detection of threats which meet Government criteria for intervention enables characterization, assessment and appropriate action to be taken early and thereby reduce the possible impacts.

As part of the UK Government's commitment to enhance veterinary surveillance, described in its Animal Health and Welfare Strategy (AHWS) document published in 2003, the Authority extended the set of species- specific quarterly surveillance reports to include horses and donkeys. Within its delivery agency Animal & Plant Health Agency (APHA), the Authority does not routinely obtain diagnostic expertise and data on equine disease in the field.

In contrast to livestock, much of the equine expertise sits outside government and equidae are served by a diverse and potentially disconnected network of private and specialist equine veterinary practice based laboratories, with specialist interest in a few specific endemic diseases based within particular research groups at universities or research institutes. Therefore, a Supplier is required to provide this intelligence.

Title: UK SBS RE21225 Laboratory Consumables Framework
Description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is Monday 27th September 2021 at 11:00am

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.

All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.

UK SBS wishes to establish a Framework Agreement for the provision of Laboratory Consumables.

UK SBS is managing this procurement process in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (as may be amended from time to time) (the "Regulations").  

This is a Supplies and Services Framework Agreement. 

The award of this Framework Agreement will be based on thirteen Lots:

Lot 1 - Plastics Major 
Lot 2 - Tissue Culture 
Lot 3 - Centrifuge bottles, Tubes & Containers (Sterile and Non-Sterile) 
Lot 4 - Filter Paper & Membranes 
Lot 5 - Histology & Microscopy Glassware
Lot 6 - Laboratory Glassware & Bottles
Lot 7 - Storage Boxes & Racks
Lot 8 - Syringes, Needles and Blood Collection
Lot 9 - Disposable Pipettes & Tips
Lot 10 - Non-Disposable Pipettes 
Lot 11 - Servicing of Non-Disposable pipettes
Lot 12 - Supply of spare parts for Non-Disposable Pipettes
Lot 13 - Laboratory Personal Protective Equipment 

This Framework will be made accessible for use by UK SBS (The Contracting Authority) and any other Government Department, Agency, or Public Body (Contracting Bodies) detailed under the Gov.uk website https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations and UK SBS's Homepage Contracts (uksbs.co.uk). This will facilitate the greater aggregation of public sector demand and enable public sector to leverage greater efficiencies.

All details are available in the RFP tender documents.

It is intended that multiple providers will be appointed for each of the Lots detailed above.

Potential bidders are invited to tender for one or more Lots or Sub Lots on an individual basis.

This Framework is being established for a term of 2 + 1 (December 1st, 2021 - November 30th, 2023 with the option to extend for a further 1 year till November 30th, 2024)

The estimated value for this Framework is £9,500,000.00 excluding VAT

Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal. 

This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria as set out in the RFP document. 

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement. To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and the follow the instructions to 'Log in' .Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: V69N3NZ749

Additional Text:
DO NOT APPLY DIRECTLY TO BUYER
All submissions will be assessed in accordance with the Public Procurement Regulations that apply to this opportunity.
Responses must be received by the date and time in the tender documentation; responses received outside of the deadline or not sent via the Delta eSourcing portal will not be accepted or considered by the Contracting Authority  for this opportunity. Interested organisations should ensure that they allow a sufficiency of time, prior to the deadline to allow all sections to be completed in full and any attachments to be uploaded.
As a user of the Delta eSourcing Portal you will have access to the Delta messaging service which facilitates all messages sent to you and from you, as well as other messages and updates in relation to any specific tender event. Please note that any and all information secured outside of the messaging service, shall have no merit or worth and should not be relied upon by any organisation submitting a tender response. 
Please note it is your organisations responsibility to access these messages on a regular basis to ensure you have sight of all relevant information applicable to this opportunity.
The Contracting Authority expressly reserves the right:

i.	not to award any contract as a result of the procurement process commenced by publication of this notice; and

ii.	to make whatever changes it may see fit to the content and structure of the procurement; and under no circumstances as part of your organisations participation in this opportunity, will the Contracting Authority be liable for any costs incurred by any organisation as a result. 
If the Contracting Authority decides to enter into a contract with any successful organisation(s), this does not mean that there is any guarantee of subsequent contracts being awarded. Any expenditure, work or effort undertaken prior to contract award is accordingly a matter solely for the commercial judgement of your organisation in doing so.
About UK Shared Business Services 
UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) brings a commercial attitude to the public sector; helping our contracting authorities to improve efficiency, generate savings and modernise.
Where UK SBS is not named as the Contracting Authority within the documentation, UK SBS will be acting as an agent on behalf of the Contracting Authority.
Our broad range of expert services is shared by our customers. This allows our customers the freedom to focus resources on core activities; innovating and transforming their own organisations.
For full details of our partner base please review the following link: http://www.uksbs.co.uk/services/procure/contracts/Pages/default.aspx

Title: SSC CHS Catering Service Contract 01_09
Description: Caterham High School are seeking a suitably qualified and experienced Contractor to supply catering services to Caterham High School, Caterham Avenue, Ilford, Essex IG5 0QW, United Kingdom.The school will sign a contract with the successful Contractor for a period of 36 months with the option to extend for up to a further 24 months. It is expected that the contract will commence 1st September 2022.Tenders must be submitted in accordance with the Invitation to Tender instructions.It is the intent of the school to offer a good value meal service to pupils and staff. Within the constraints of the meal price the Tenderer shall be required to provide a good quality, nutritionally balanced meal for the children, through an efficient service with a good standard of presentation and a menu that meets the varying dietary needs of the nationalities of the children. Service should be personal and responsive.The school require a separate provision for the 6th form, offering an all-day service, providing a range of suitable snacks and beverages that are appealing and priced to retain patronage throughout the day. A coffee offer is central to the provision of these offers.The school would like an external service pod with an undercover seating area for students.In addition, there is a potential to offer a service for lettings. Tenderers proposals and ideas will be welcomed and considered.The school is keen to appoint a catering contractor who can drive the services forward in an innovative and exciting manor.

Organisation Name: Skanska Costain STRABAG Joint Venture (SCS JV)
Title: HS2 Main Works S1 & S2 - WP148_Noise Barriers (precast reinforced-concrete noise barrier panels on a supply-only basis)
Description:
The scope for this package is the supply of 571 no. precast reinforced-concrete noise barrier panels, which will form part of the noise barrier structure to be constructed along the north and south sides of the High Speed Two (HS2) trace at the West Ruislip retained embankment and the Gatemead embankment. The noise barrier structure will also be constructed across the River Pinn Underbridge (RPU) and the Breakspear Road Underbridge (BRSU) structures. The breakdown of the required number of precast reinforced-concrete noise barrier panels is as follows:
      
      - Noise Barrier South Standard Panels: 248 no. c.5.60m-high precast reinforced-concrete noise barrier panels, with a c.30.60 deg. cranked edge commencing at roughly 2.30m high. Lengths are between  2.70m and 3.78m.
      - Noise Barrier South Transition Zone Panels: 16 no. precast reinforced-concrete noise barrier panels, again with a cranked edge. Heights are between 6.19m and 6.37m, with lengths between 2.95m and 2.99m.
      - Noise Barrier South Bridge Panels: 18 no. straight precast reinforced-concrete noise barrier panels (no cranked edge). Heights are between 5.73m and 7.00m, with lengths between 1.50m and 3.22m.
      - Noise Barrier North Standard Panels: 253 no. c.3.10m-high straight precast reinforced-concrete noise barrier panels (no cranked edge). Lengths are between 2.59m and 3.04m.
      - Noise Barrier North Transition Zone Panels: 18 no. straight precast reinforced-concrete noise barrier panels (no cranked edge). Heights are between 3.46m and 3.60m, with lengths between 2.97m and 3.00m.
      - Noise Barrier North Bridge Panels: 18 no. straight precast reinforced-concrete noise barrier panels (no cranked edge). Heights are between 3.23m and 4.50m, with lengths between 1.50m and 3.22m.
      
      The attached drawing provides a visual representation of the proposed noise barrier structure.
      
      The goods are to include lifting points (hooks/eyes/etc.) and tie-in points for temporary works purposes.
      
      The services are:
      
      - production of shop drawings,
      - design of the lifting and tie-in points,
      - creation of the necessary moulds,
      - fabrication/casting of the required precast reinforced-concrete noise barrier panels, and
      - delivery to SCS JV's site and SCS JV's testing subcontractor's facilities (location TBC).
      
      There may also be a requirement for storage space, depending upon the proposals for the noise barrier panels to be delivered on a just-in-time basis.

Title: National Framework Agreement for the provision of Refurbished Electronic Devices and Repair Services
Description:
The aim of the proposed framework is to provide a sustainable and cost-effective method to extend the life cycle of mobile electronic devices.  By using mobile electronic devices for longer there will be a reduction in the environmental impact from the decrease in the quantity of devices created and disposed of each year.

The scope of the proposed framework will include: 

Lot 1: Repair of electronic devices
Lot 2: Supply of refurbished devices
Lot 3: Complete Service - Repair of electronic devices and supply of refurbished devices

The Countess of Chester Hospital NHS Foundation Trust's Commercial Procurement Service anticipates appointing all Bidders who score a total of 60% or more for a Lot (who have met the minimum requirements which are set out in these ITT documents) to supply the services under that Lot, as detailed within the specification at SCHEDULE A FRAMEWORK AGREEMENT SPECIFICATION.
Attachments: F078 2022 ITT v3.pdf F078 2022 List of Eligible Users.pdf F078 2022 SCHEDULE A-Specification.pdf F078 2022 SCHEDULE C Prerequisites.docx F078 2022 FTS Notice.pdf
Additional Text:
Suppliers Instructions
How to Express Interest and bid for this ITT:
1. Browse to the esourcing portal
https://www.nhssourcing.co.uk
and click on viewcurrent opportunities
2. Select the title of the ITT.
3. Review the ITT, Framework Agreement Specification, Prerequisites and List of Eligible Users (you may do this without registering).
4. Register your organisation on the eSourcing portal (this is only required once).
5. Accept the portal terms and conditions and click 'continue', Enter your organisation and user details, Note the username you chose and click 'Save'when complete. You will shortly receive an e-mail with your unique password (please keep this secure).
6. Login to the portal with the username/password.
7. Click the 'PQQs/ITTs Open To All Suppliers' link. (These are PreQualification Questionnaires or Invitations to Tender open to any registered supplier)
8. Click on the relevant PQQ/ITT to access the content.
9. Click the 'Express Interest' button at the top of the page. This will move the PQQ/ITT into your 'My PQQs/My ITTs' page. (This is a secure area reserved for your projects only). You can now access any attachments by clicking 'Buyer Attachments'in the 'PQQ/ITT Details' box.
10. Responding to the ITT. Click 'My Response' under 'PQQ/ITT Details', you can choose to 'Create Response' or to 'Decline to Respond' (please give a reason if declining) You can now use the Messages function to communicate with the buyer and seek any clarification. Note the deadline for completion, then follow the on-screen instructions to complete the ITT. There may be a mixture of online and offline actions for you to perform (there is detailed online help available) You must then submit your reply using the 'Submit Response' button at the top of the page. If you require any further assistance please consult the online help, or contact theTendering help desk.

Title: Manufacture & Supply of Analyser Crystals for F2 XES to be used in the XFEL Hub's von Hamos Spectrometer
Description:
DLS are looking for the Manufacture and Supply of the following set of cylindrically bent germanium analyser crystals for the 16-analyser von Hamos spectrometer for X-ray emission spectroscopy (XES) that the XFEL Hub is designing for installation at the Diamond Light Source beamlines:  -  16 x Ge (620) crystals to use this reflection for the Fe Kβ emission line.
Each analyser crystal should be mounted on an aluminium block with tapped holes on the underside as described in Section 3.  The analyser crystals will be mounted into a separate hold in air.  This holder is not part of the scope of this project and will be designed and built by DLS.

To apply visit our website which requires suppliers to complete a one-off simple registration form, which will generate a unique password for your account. You are then able to login to register your interest against the Tender and download the tender documents.

Title: 23274 - Derriford Monitoring Surveyor
Description:
Specialist expertise and services of an independent firm of building surveyors to act on its behalf in a project monitoring role. The role is required to safeguard PCC's interest in respect of the development and ensure no residual liability falls upon PCC as landlord.\r
\r
Specifically this project monitoring role is to:\r
- Review and approve monthly drawdown applications;\r
- Review and confirm that all necessary documentation has been provided by the developer;\r
- Review and approve requests for practical completion of parts and all of the development; and\r
- Review and approve the release of any retention payments.\r
\r
This will necessitate attending monthly meetings and inspections to consider the certified developer's drawdown requests and providing input into the practical completion process, retentions, snagging, etc. Monthly drawdown reports will be required to certify amounts.

The University of Chester was seeking to appoint one contractor to provide Door Inspection and Survey services as set out in the Document 2.3 - Door Survey Specification.

and was seeking to appoint one contractor to provide 'Fire / Other Door Inspection and Survey' Services as set out in the specification, for buildings comprising the majority of the University's estate.

The procurement documents were available for unrestricted and full direct access, free of charge, at: https://in-tendhost.co.uk/universityofchester.

Organisation Name: The Police and Crime Commissioner for Derbyshire
Title: The Provision of Civilian Detention Officer Services
Description:
Derbyshire Constabulary and Crime Commissioner are seeking to outsource the Provision of Civilian Detention Officers (CDOs) in Custody within their force authority area.
This is within the secure estate of a police custody suites. As such it is ancillary to the role the police have of investigating crime. In this respect the Police are strictly governed by legislation in particular the Police and Criminal Evidence Act 1984 and its Codes of Practice. This places a specific legal responsibility on the Custody Officer who is responsible for ensuring the legal process is discharged and has a strict duty of care to all detainees. 
The overall management of the contract to provide custody support is viewed as a partnership between the contracting authority and the successful bidder. The services provided will be effective, efficient, and meet the needs of the stakeholders and users, with CDO cover in line with agreed staffing levels and the appropriate balance of male and female CDO's for each team.

Management practices will be supportive, innovative, and flexible and promote a 'can do' attitude with a strong focus on service delivery and performance improvement.

The Contracting Authority is seeking to expand the service currently provided by CDOs to include level 3 and 4 observations and detainee escorts to hospital to support a police officer.

Title: Provision of GPA LAN Requirements
Description:
The Government Property Agency (GPA), as part of its Government Estates Strategy 2018 remit to drive savings across the government estate, is looking to establish a number of multi-departmental offices in strategic regional locations (known as "Government Workplaces" or colloquially as "Hubs"). Relocating civil and public servants from existing, often fragmented locations, to modern, cross-departmental shared workplaces will make the most of emerging working practices, of which technology is a fundamental component.
GPA required a strategic delivery partner to provide:
Input to GPA's Strategic direction for Shared Network (LAN).
Design, sourcing, implementation, testing and transition of support to GPA's Service Partner of a shared network across a number of sites UK wide.
Management for the onboarding and full integration of all services to the Shared Network (LAN). This includes the landlord, other GPA suppliers and tenant services.
Account and Delivery Management.
Provide a scalable, technology agnostic solution that provides an appropriate set of technologies to reduce vendor lock-in as well as reducing dependence on a single vendor.
Contact Name: Crown Commercial Service on behalf of Government Property Agency : Cabinet Office

It is based on our core purpose, to inspire excellence to achieve the remarkable and build an inclusive world. In order for this to be realised high quality and effective UEB leadership across the change initiatives will ultimately deliver the required transformation and achieve the desired outcomes. Title: Provision of a Leisure Assets Management Agent
Description:
Blackpool Council is seeking to procure services required in relation to recreational/tourist sites which fall within social, cultural, recreational, catering services under the "light touch regime" as set out at Regulations 74-76 PCR 2015. 

(Direct Link to Opportunity https://procontract.due-north.com/Advert?advertId=81b332b5-40d1-ec11-8114-005056b64545&fromProjectDashboard=True) 
 
The Council intends to appoint a single organisation to a framework agreement for the management and evaluation of its tourist attraction for a period of up to four years. The Council anticipates awarding an initial two year management services contract in relation to the Sandcastle Waterpark at the same time as awarding the framework agreement, and it may elect to extend this contract for a further two years or award a long term management contract (up to twenty years extendable in five yearly increments) to the framework holder. The scope of the procurement is intended to cover additional attractions within the Council's area (including without limitation tourist attractions, recreational facilities and cultural venues) and the Council may award interim or long term management services for such venues to the selected operator throughout the term of the framework agreement.  The framework agreement is not however awarded on an exclusive basis and the Council reserves the right to award contracts for similar services outside of the framework.

The Council is conducting a single stage procedure which will evaluate price and quality of submissions received. In order to suit the Council's wider requirements the process will include the option to negotiate should it be required. The option to negotiate may be waived should it be possible for a preferred bidder to be appointed following receipt of proposals.

Title: Asbestos Removal & Make Safe Service
Description:
Nature: Asbestos Removal and Making Safe Service - both to dwellings and to corporate buildings.

Location: Within the boundaries of the London Borough of Hillingdon and at the location of any other dwellings managed by the Council that are outside these boundaries.

The service is to be provided to Council properties. This is corporate buildings for which the Council has a responsibility, and dwellings, garages and out buildings, occupied by tenants and lessees of the Council's housing stock.  

The number of tenanted dwellings is in the region of 10,300 and the number of leasehold properties is 2,950.  These numbers will vary over the life of the contract.
The council's corporate property portfolio comprises of approximately 230 buildings and pieces of land.

The types of service and works to be undertaken in the contract will include but not limited to the following:
-	Asbestos removal
-	Making Safe
-	Encapsulation and labelling of asbestos containing materials remaining in-situ.

There is no guarantee of the value of work that may be ordered and the Council accepts no liability as to the actual amount of work that will be ordered and no change in the rates or prices will be considered if the value and / or volume of work ordered is at variance with the estimates given.  

Length of contract - The Service duration is to be three (3) years with options to extend for a further two (2) year at the Council's sole discretion.
Additional Text: I would confirm that the London Borough of Hillingdon is NOT inviting all interested organisations to tender through the Council's nominated electronic tendering portal as this is an Award Notice

Title: Sandwell Domiciliary Care Service - AWARD
Description:
ASC084 Domiciliary Care Service - Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council wishes to appoint 15 Providers to the Tier 1 List and an unlimited number of Providers to the Tier 2 List for the provision of Domiciliary Care to eligible individuals living in Sandwell. All Providers will be appointed to deliver the Service across the whole of the Borough of Sandwell.  
      
      It is anticipated that the Service will support approximately 20,000 to 25 000 hours of care per week, however the amount of hours of care per week may vary during the duration of the Agreement.
      
      The Service will provide a broad range of general personal care and support services to eligible adults (18 years old and over) aimed at enabling individuals to maintain and recover maximum independence, support their wellbeing, provide support to individuals who have recently left hospital and ultimately allow people to remain living in their own homes.

Title: Procurement of services of a website developer for the ASEAN Sustainable Leadership in Infrastructure Programme
Description:
The UK and ASEAN have been collaborating closely on Sustainable Infrastructure; exchanging broad ideas on project planning, preparation and appraisal, funding and procurement, and establishing sustainability in practice. 

Building on this momentum, the UK has decided to further boost ASEAN Member States (AMS) capacity by creating a modular course sharing best practise and lessons learnt for developing truly sustainable infrastructure which maximises on the socio-economic benefits for the region. Aimed at policy makers and practitioners, this course will:
1.	Support the Framework for Improving ASEAN Infrastructure Productivity through exchanging knowledge on upstream infrastructure management. Share best practise on developing and implementing robust, merit-based frameworks for project screening, planning and appraisal; including assessing value for money, commercial viability, financial affordability and operational deliverability.
2.	Share lessons learned on implementing sustainability in practice, including preserving ecological value of the site and optimising existing infrastructure projects and assets.
3.	Support the Framework for Improving ASEAN Infrastructure Productivity through exchanging knowledge and best practise on attracting private sector investment. Strengthen capacity on public investment management and procurement. 

The curriculum, designed by the Authority, is as follows:
	Theme 1: Towards Net Zero: Impact on Urbanism & Infrastructure 
	Theme 2: Sustainable Systems to Delivery Better Built Environment
	Theme 3: Enablers to 'Build Back Better'	
	Theme 4: Project Delivery Frameworks
	Theme 5: Sustainable Funding & Financing
	Theme 6: Towards Net Zero Contracts & Procurement
	Theme 7: Leveraging Support & Collaborations Towards a Net Zero World

The course will involve participants from all ten AMS. The content for the course has been developed through discussions with ASEAN Secretariat by experts from various organisations. The course will be delivered virtually

The Authority is looking to procure an online portal through which the developed course will be managed.

Your Tender must be submitted to APAC.Procurement@FCDO.gov.uk using the reference "ASLIPWD" in the subject line accordance with the enclosed ITT Instructions.
Region: United Kingdom,Isle of Man,British Oversea Territories,Europe,Rest of the World

Title: Local Welfare Furniture Provision - AWARD
Description:
Local Welfare Provision is provided in Sandwell for the purpose of assisting vulnerable people in meeting their needs for subsistence where they are unable to meet their immediate short-term needs or where they require assistance to maintain their independence within the community.  This aligns to Sandwell Council's key principals of tackling inequality and reducing poverty. 
      
      A significant element of the scheme is to provide second hand furniture and household items in order to support vulnerable residents to live independently. The Council currently engages with voluntary sector organisations who deliver these items on behalf of the Council. 
      
      The selected supplier must be registered as a charity through the Charities Commission or equivalent.

Title: 2022-08-23 15:00 - QOC439 Beccles to The Wherry School, Norwich, Norfolk - AWARD
Description:
Suffolk County Council is seeking a mini competition against the following Dynamic Purchasing System: `The supply of Passenger Transport Services`, OJEU Notice Id: 2018/S 031-067685.
      
      Beccles to The Wherry School, Norwich, Norfolk.
      
      Further details can be found in the 'Tenders / My Tenders' area of this website, by selecting the 'View Details' button for this project.
      
      The deadline for returned submissions is 15:00 Tuesday 23rd August 2022. Please note late returns will NOT be permitted.

Title: Framework for the Provision of Apprenticeship Training Providers - AWARD
Description:
Hampshire County Council invites applications from suitably experienced organisations who wish to be considered for selection to tender for the Provision of Apprenticeship Training Providers. 
      
      The Framework will commence on 1st September 2022 and will be for a period of three years with the option to extend for a further one year.
      
      Interested parties should register their interest in the project via the In-Tend website https://in-tendhost.co.uk/hampshire, and complete and submit the tender return document together with any supporting information requested by 14.00 hrs on Wednesday 23rd March 2022.  
      
      How to obtain the Tender Documents
      The Tender documents can be accessed when logged into In-Tend by selecting 'View Details' on the relevant tender advert and clicking the 'Express Interest' tab. Once in the tender there are five tabs - 'Tender', 'ITT - documents', 'Correspondence', 'Clarifications' and 'History'. Select the 2nd tab (ITT - documents) where you will find useful information under 'Tender Details' continue to scroll down to the heading 'Tender Documents Received' where you will be able to view / download the documents.
      
      Please download all the documents and read very carefully.
      
      Opting In and Opting Out
      Please note you are required to 'Opt In' before you can access the 'My tender Return' to start populating your response. 
      
      The framework is lotted by Apprenticeship Technical Pathways into 17 lots.
      PLEASE NOTE you are required to 'Opt In' to view & complete the relevant Questionnaire per lot for this project. 
      
      Important information
      Please ensure that you regularly save your questionnaire as you complete it. Please note, if you have been inactive on the portal (meaning you haven't clicked any button) for more than 10 minutes, the session may freeze or time out and you may lose the information you have input.
      
      We would recommend that for any questions, where a comprehensive written answer is required, please create these outside of the system (e.g. MS Word) and cut and paste into the appropriate question answer.
      
      The 'Opt Out' functionality will also be available throughout the duration of the tender process. Opting out will give you the option of declaring you no longer want to receive any further communication in relation to this tender along with the opportunity of providing comments and feedback for this decision.
      
      You can choose to 'Opt In' at any time during the tender process if you initially decided to 'Opt Out'.
      
      Further Guidance
      In addition, guidance on how to participate in a tender - download and upload documents / returns and if required, register your company (free of charge), can be found on the In-tend site under the 'Help' or 'Information for Suppliers' buttons.
      
      Receiving Notification Emails
      To ensure you receive email alerts and notifications from our system, please add the email domain `@in-tendorganiser.co.uk`  to your Safe S...
