Title: T0352 TRCD3057 OZEV Rapid Charging Fund Application Process Analytical Framework requirement
Description:
The Department for Transport and the Office of Zero Emission Vehicles (OZEV) (Client) are looking to put in place an overarching agreement to cover the following list of topics contained under Lot1 with an initial commitment for economics, statistics and transport modelling.
The Department for Transport wishes to commission an analytical framework with accompanying guidance and analytical tools to support bidders in their applications to the Rapid Charging Fund (RCF, sometimes referred as "Project Rapid"). 
The objective of this framework, guidance and toolkit will be to support RCF applicants to arrive at a robust estimation of additional capacity on the electricity network required at specific sites, to meet different levels electric vehicle (EV) demand in the future. We are therefore inviting Suppliers to provide a detailed proposal and costs for this work under the SPATS 2 Framework. 
The primary customer will be OZEV team under the DfT. 
The output required for this work is an analytical framework, with accompanying guidance and tools that set out how to produce the required evidence to apply for the fund. The deliverables are required by December 2022.
This document outlines the background of the project, the anticipated approach, deliverables, and timing for the service.
The Intellectual Property created for this service shall be owned by the Client.
Attachments: T0352 TRCD3057 SPaTS 2 DfT Award Letter - FUTRAN - trans.docx
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [FUTRAN|WOKINGHAM|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: T0356 Road markings for digital roads research
Description:
National Highways (the Client) is seeking the provision of services to undertake a research into the following two areas:
- Road markings for digital roads
- Carbon emissions in traffic signs, road markings and studs
The objective of this work order is to undertake research to:
- determine the road marking performance necessary for the effective operation of connected and autonomous vehicles (CAVs) and their associated safety systems such as the automated lane keeping system.
- better understand the impact that traffic signs, road markings and studs have on our carbon footprint, and to seek opportunities to reduce carbon through improvements in materials, manufacturing processes and plant to support the National Highways net zero Carbon Plan.

      1.Service Contract for PHE

      •24hr Breakdown Cover

Title: CP2236-22 Southern Construction Framework Comprehensive Accreditation Scheme Provider (CASP)
Description: The Southern Construction Framework (SCF) has been set up as a collaborative initiative between Devon County Council (DCC) and Hampshire County Council (HCC), as a multi lot regional construction, consultancy and housing framework currently there are 33 contractors engaged by the frameworks (theoretically more places could be awarded than the current number of appointed contractors based on the Lot structure having diversity but in practice the actual number of contractors is smaller). The Authority requires a comprehensive accreditation scheme provider to assess, accredit and support the monitoring of contractors engaged on the SCF for when the current Comprehensive Accreditation Scheme Provider's contract comes to an end in February 2023.

Title: Framework for Demolition and Associated Services
Description:
Lot 1: Demolition Projects
The scope of the work is of all project values. Typically, the work will be comprised of the following categories but is not exclusive to:
•	High rise work (hand, machine, high reach or explosives),
•	Low rise work (hand or machine),
•	Emergency responsive call out work,
•	Securing and boarding up of empty and dilapidated properties.
•	Asbestos removal
•	Site remediation
•	Waste removal/disposal

Lot 2: Emergency demolition.
The scope of the work is of all project values to provide an emergency response service during working hours only. Works will include but is not exclusive to: 
•	Full or partial dismantlement of buildings or structures using mechanical or hand demolition techniques.
•	Temporary structural support to building elements (Via 3rd party contractor is necessary)
•	Reinstatement of building elements if demolition is not a feasible option. (Via 3rd party contractor is necessary)
•	To provide site security (via 3rd party contractors if necessary)
•	To provide heras type fencing. 
•	To secure buildings to prevent access to dangerous buildings. 
•	To sample and remove asbestos.    

Lot 3: Demolition enabling and emergency security works 24hrs. 
The scope of the work is of all project values to provide a planned and 24hr emergency response service during working hours only. Works will include but is not exclusive to: 
1.	Provide during and out-of-working hours emergency response including:
•	To secure buildings which have been opened to unauthorised access. 
•	To provide heras type fencing. 
•	To provide site security (via 3rd party contractors if necessary)
•	To remove or secure minor hazardous building elements, which pose a threat to public safety, for example but not limited to:
	Loose tiles and slates
	Shards of glass hanging from window frames
	Loose guttering or downpipes

2.	Provide demolition enabling works during working hours including:
•	To clear building of chattels and fittings as required
•	To secure buildings to restrict unauthorised access
•	To provide access for surveys and inspections
•	To re-secure buildings which have been opened to unauthorised access
•	To remove hazardous building elements which

Title: WP3790 - Bereavement Support and Counselling & Talking Therapies - AWARD
Description:
The Council wishes to procure providers to offer Bereavement Support and Counselling & Talking Therapies to a number of communities within the Walsall Borough including but not limited to:
      
      ? Providing Support
      ? Raising Awareness amongst communities
      ? Future development from feedback
      ? Group and Individual Support
      ? Help people to Improve their mental health and wellbeing
      
      It is the Council's intention to divide these requirements into two (2) Lots as follows:
      
      LOT 1 - Bereavement Support - The provision of Place Based Community Bereavement Support will support communities impacted by complex grief.
      
      LOT 2 - Counselling & Talking Therapies - The provision of Place Based Counselling and Talking Therapies will help people suffering from mild to moderate stress and anxiety to improve their mental health and wellbeing. 
      Both Place Based Community Bereavement Support and Place Based Counselling and Talking Therapies will work in synergy to deliver across a diverse range of community settings to meet the diverse needs of Walsall residents. The provision will be culturally appropriate and will target support towards our most disadvantaged populations with a view to improving mental wellbeing inequalities.
      
      Lots 1 and 2 will operate as an integrated part of the Improving Access to Psychological Therapies (IAPT) pathways and the No Wrong Door Network.  In addition, the service will provide integrated support via the Health Improvement Service and the developing wellbeing service.

Title: IA2682 Interpretation Design Scheme for the Staffordshire History Centre
Description:
Staffordshire County Council and The William Salt Library Trust are working in partnership to deliver a complex heritage project funded by The National Lottery Heritage Fund. 
      
      The Council will be awarding a construction contractor to carry out the works on the buildings in question being the Staffordshire Record Office and the Grade II* listed William Salt Library, which are located on the same site in a close proximity but currently separate with the two services operating in tandem. 
      
      The construction contractor will be linking Staffordshire Record Office and the William Salt Library to create 550 square metres of fully accessible public space known as the Staffordshire History Centre. It will include spaces for learning, events and exhibitions whilst retaining quiet study areas for research.
      
      For this tender the Council wish to appoint a design consultant to provide an interpretation design scheme for the Staffordshire History Centre. 
      
      The successful consultant will also be required to do the following:
      •	liaise closely with the SHC Project Team, the designers and contractors throughout the process
      •	contribute to the evaluation of the design, build and installation of the interpretation scheme
      •	attend regular meetings with the project architects
      •	project manage the installation of the interpretation plan
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Imagemakers Design & Consultancy Ltd|The Old School, Sticklepath, Okehampton, GB, EX20 2NJ, GB|NONE||No|No]

Description:
Derbyshire County Council (DCC) are seeking to enter into a long term partnership to improve its intelligent Transport System (ITS) assets over the next 10 years. The contract will be for up to 10 years based on an initial period of 5 years followed extension of between 1 & 5 years (5 years + 1 - 5).
DCC will appoint a single contractor for the design, supply, install, and maintenance of our traffic signals and related communications infrastructure. Additionally, DCC are looking for a contractor to also provide first line maintenance for our VMS and VAS signs.
Dependant on the performance of the contractor, DCC will add maintenance of CCTV, RMS, UTC, and UTMC from year 5 of the contract.
